page.title: 05ECOLOGY OF THE RIVER LEVEN
page.content: IN THE AREA WE ARE COVERING THE RIVER LEVEN IS CHANNELLED INTO WHAT IS KNOWN AS "THE CUT".THIS WAS BUILT IN 1832 TO STOP THE RIVER FLOODING.IN AND AROUND THE CUT THERE IS A LARGE VARIETY OF FLORA AND FAUNA.LOCAL ANGLING CLUBS RECENTLY ATTEMPTED TO RE-STOCK THE RIVER HIGHLIGHTS THE FACTTHAT THE RIVER LEVEN ONCE WAS KNOWN FOR ITS SALMON AND SEA TROUT FISHING OVER TWO CENTURIES AGO.THEY ARE NOW ABSENT FROM THE RIVER DUE TO INDUSTRIAL POLLUTION. THE RIVER CONTAINS TROUT,PERCH,MINNOW, STICKLEBACK AND LAMPREY PLUS A FEW EELS.BIRDLIFE INCLUDES DIPPER,GREY WAGTAIL AND SOME KINGFISHERS.THE KINGFISHERS HAVE BEEN PRESENT IN 1983 AND 1984 PROBABLY NESTING TO THE EAST. THE ONLY SIGNIFICANT POLLUTION IS FROM PHOSPHATIC MANURES IN EARLY SUMMER RESULTING IN A BLUE-GREEN ALGAE.
